document.docAuthor: Li, Di, Aspöck, Horst, Aspöck, Ulrike & Liu, Xingyue
document.docTitle: Dilar kirgisus H. Aspock & U. Aspock 1967
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the pleasing lacewing genus Dilar Rambur (Neuroptera, Dilaridae) from Central Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the pleasing lacewing genus Dilar Rambur (Neuroptera, Dilaridae) from Central Asia

taxonomicName.emphasis: Dilar kirgisus H. Aspöck & U. Aspöck, 1967

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dilar kirgisus H. Aspöck & U.
Aspöck, 1967: 59
. Type locality: Kyrgyzstan , Issyk-Kul.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dilar golestani Mirmoayedi & Yassayie, 1999: 18
. Type locality: Iran , Golestan , Almeh ( Monserrat 2005 , Oswald 2019 ).

Diagnosis. This species is characterized by the forewing with numerous pale brown spots; the male tergum 9 with rectangular dorsoprocessus, slightly narrowed medially, widened and convex on posterior margin; the male gonocoxite 9 distally with an acutely pointed apex; the male gonocoxite 10 with blade-shaped apex and spinous subdistal projection.
Description. Male. Forewing length 7.2–11.5 mm , hindwing length 6.5–10.5 mm .

Head yellowish brown, with yellow setose tubercles. Compound eyes blackish brown. Antennal socket pale yellow. Antenna yellowish brown but brown medially, scape with a yellow annular stripe distally, flagellum pectinate on most flagellomeres, medial branches much longer than those on both ends, longest branch nearly 3.5 times as long as corresponding flagellomere, distal six flagellomeres simple.

Prothorax yellow, pronotum yellow, slightly darker on posterior portion; mesothorax yellow, mesonotum yellowish brown on anterior and lateral margins; metathorax yellow, metanotum slightly darker on lateral margins. Legs yellow but yellowish brown distally. Wings hyaline, yellowish. Forewing 3.0 times as long as wide, with numerous pale brown spots, proximal spots slightly darker, arranged irregularly; veins generally pale yellow. Hindwing 2.6 times as long as wide, almost immaculate.

Distribution. Iran ( Alborz , Golestan , Markazi ); Kyrgyzstan (Issyk-Kul, Chuy, Jalal-Abad, Osh ); Turkmenistan (Eroyulandus).

Remarks. This species can be distinguished from all the other
Dilar
species from Central Asia by the rectangular dorsoprocessus which is slightly narrowed medially, widened and convex on posterior margin ( Fig. 36 ), and the male gonocoxite 10 with blade-shaped apex and spinous subdistal projection ( Fig. 37 ).

Our examined specimens from Iran , India and Kyrgyzstan display intraspecific variations of male gonocoxite 10. The typical condition of the male gonocoxite 10 in this species is that the subdistal projection and the apex of this sclerite are subtriangular and acutely pointed. However, in some conspecific individuals (Figs 51–59), the subdistal projection of male gonocoxite 10 is reduced or directed posteromedially, or the apex of male gonocoxite 10 is slightly blunt. Based on our examination, no obvious geographic differences are discernable among the three areas.
